intro: Rudbeckia laciniata var. digitata, commonly known as the showy goldenrod, is a striking perennial plant native to North America. It features large, daisy-like yellow flowers with a prominent brown center, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant has lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are green and slightly hairy on the upper surface. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Rudbeckia laciniata var. digitata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
